title: 2017 National Premier Leagues
text:
The 2017 National Premier Leagues was the fifth season of the Australian <a href="National%20Premier%20Leagues">National Premier Leagues</a> <a href="association%20football">football</a> competition. The league competition was played amongst eight separate divisions, divided by <a href="Football%20Federation%20Australia">FFA</a> state and territory member federations. The divisions are <a href="National%20Premier%20Leagues%20Capital%20Football">ACT</a>, <a href="National%20Premier%20Leagues%20NSW">NSW</a>, <a href="National%20Premier%20Leagues%20Northern%20NSW">Northern NSW</a>, <a href="National%20Premier%20Leagues%20Queensland">Queensland</a>, <a href="National%20Premier%20Leagues%20South%20Australia">South Australia</a>, <a href="National%20Premier%20Leagues%20Tasmania">Tasmania</a>, <a href="National%20Premier%20Leagues%20Victoria">Victoria</a> and <a href="National%20Premier%20Leagues%20Western%20Australia">Western Australia</a>.
The winners of each respective divisional league competed in a finals playoff tournament at season end, with <a href="Heidelberg%20United%20FC">Heidelberg United</a> crowned as Champions, which gave them direct qualification for the <a href="2018%20FFA%20Cup">2018 FFA Cup</a> Round of 32.
Final Series.
The winner of each league competition (top of the table) in the NPL competed in a single match knockout tournament to decide the National Premier Leagues Champion for 2017. The quarter final match-ups were decided by an open draw. Home advantage for the semi-finals and final was based on a formula relating to time of winning (normal time, extra time or penalties), goals scored and allowed, and yellow/red cards. The winner also qualified for the <a href="2018%20FFA%20Cup">2018 FFA Cup</a> Round of 32.
Individual honours.
<a href="Sean%20Ellis%20%28footballer%29">Sean Ellis</a> from <a href="Heidelberg%20United%20FC">Heidelberg United</a> won the <a href="John%20Kosmina%20Medal">John Kosmina Medal</a> for the best player in the NPL Grand Final.
